para.text: Except as provided under Regulation .03 of this chapter, a Maryland-eligible REC shall be recorded with GATS.
If not required by GATS, the REC recordation under §A of this regulation shall include:
The name of the Maryland certified renewable energy facility;
A description of the renewable source of generation for the REC;
The month and year of the generation of the energy represented by the REC; and
The Tier 1 renewable source or Tier 2 renewable source associated with the REC.
A Maryland eligible REC issued to a renewable on-site generator under this regulation is valid for compliance for the calendar year of generation and the following 2 calendar years.

section.heading: REC Creation from Renewable On-Site Generation.

para.text: Except under §C of this regulation, a renewable on-site generator may receive a Maryland-eligible REC associated with on-site generation if:
The renewable on-site generator is certified as a renewable energy facility under COMAR 20.61.02;
An authorized representative of the renewable on-site generator enters its generation data at least annually in a GATS account maintained in good standing; and

An authorized representative of the non-solar renewable on-site generator files a non-solar renewable on-site generator report with the Commission under §B of this regulation within 1 week of each recording with GATS.
The non-solar renewable on-site generator report required under §A of this regulation shall be on a form provided by the Commission.

A Level 1 solar renewable energy facility may receive a Maryland-eligible REC associated with on-site generation based on the schedule established by the Commission derived from Commission certified engineering estimates under COMAR 20.61.02 if:
The Level 1 solar facility is certified as a renewable energy facility under COMAR 20.61.02; and
The Level 1 solar facility or its authorized representative enters generation data into a GATS.
A Maryland-eligible REC issued to a renewable on-site generator under this regulation is considered issued only upon its recording with GATS.
A Maryland-eligible REC issued to a renewable on-site generator under this regulation is valid for compliance for the calendar year of generation and the following 2 calendar years.

section.heading: Creation of RECs Based on Generation Not Delivered Into the PJM Region.
section.text: A supplier may request recognition of a REC associated with a Tier 1 renewable source or Tier 2 renewable source not delivered into the PJM region under the following conditions:

para.text: The electricity is generated at a facility that has been certified by the Commission under COMAR 20.61.02;
One of the following:
Certification by the operator of the control area in which the facility is located of the total number of megawatt-hours (MWhs) generated at the facility by month and calendar year; or
If the operator of the control area is unable to make the certification under §B(2)(a) of this regulation:

An affidavit from the operator of the control area attesting that the operator is unable to certify the total number of megawatt-hours generated by the named applicant facility for the specific year in question; and
A certification by the applicant of the total number of megawatt-hours generated at the facility for each calendar year;
Certification by the authorized representative of the facility that the RECs associated with the electricity have not expired or been retired, transferred, or redeemed; and
The electricity is generated within the PJM Region or in a state adjacent to the PJM control area.

section.heading: GATS — Maryland REC Designation.
section.text: If a renewable energy facility is approved by the Commission under COMAR 20.61.02 and the facility's GATS account continues to be maintained in good standing, the renewable energy facility may achieve a Maryland designation for a Tier 1 renewable source or Tier 2 renewable source REC recorded with GATS before the Commission's approval of the facility only during the calendar year of the Commission's approval.

section.heading: Decertified Renewable Energy Facility.
section.text: Any REC transferred or sold to a supplier, including a Level 1 solar REC transferred under COMAR 20.61.01.05C(1), before the date of decertification of the renewable energy facility where the REC was created shall remain Maryland-eligible.
